Police say Richard Nicolas killed 2-year-old Aja, but friends say they\'re certain he didn\'t. ', 'articles.baltimoresun.com'), ('Baltimore Orioles: A mixed bag of results - birdswatcher.com', 'First and foremost, the Orioles dropped game three of a four game set to Cleveland yesterday 11-5. Cleveland bats have really feasted on Oriole pitching thus far this series. Dana Eveland made a spot start out of the bullpen and pitched 3.2 innings giving up five runs over six hits, walking two and striking out five. Eveland didn\xe2\x80\x99t appear to have too much pizzazz on his pitches, and the same can be said for Tommy Hunter who followed Eveland in the game. Both pitchers\xe2\x80\x99 pitches were sailing high into the zone with little to no movement; prime and ready for the picking. Part of the issue this entire series has been that Shin-Soo Choo has hit the Orioles hard from the lead 0ff spot, going 8-for-13 thus far. That sets the tone for the rest of the lineup, which has followed suit.However all was not lost yesterday for the Orioles. That might be a difficult statement to justify given that the lost the game, but work with me folks. The fans that have been screaming for more cowbell\xc2\xa0all season long are getting their wish starting today. As the game wore on news of a trade started to sprinkle throughout Camden Yards. The Orioles traded P Kyle Simon and C Gabrielle Lino to Philadelphia for veteran slugger Jim Thome, who\xe2\x80\x99s expected to be in uniform at Camden Yards in time for this afternoon\xe2\x80\x99s game. First off, both Simon and Lino are low-level prospects, with low ceilings. (And keep in mind that in Lino\xe2\x80\x99s case he\xe2\x80\x99s a catcher in a system that currently has a young gold glove catcher at the major league level.) Secondly, the name Jim Thome speaks for itself. He\xe2\x80\x99s only hitting .242 for the season, but he\xe2\x80\x99s also only played in 30 games thus far for Philadelphia. He had a whale of a series at the yard against the Orioles several weeks ago, and he\xe2\x80\x99s always hit well at Camden Yards.The issue of course is that Thome will clog up the DH spot for the most part, forcing the Orioles to continue their parade of fielders in different spots more so than they have thus far in the season. Yesterday we saw Chris Davis have a tough time digging balls out of the right field corner, which led to Cleveland base runners getting extra bases. However the O\xe2\x80\x99s also had some fluky things happen to them in this game, not all of which were anyone\xe2\x80\x99s fault. The tone for the game was set early on when Eveland\xe2\x80\x99s first two pitches went for base hits. Jose Lopez then hit a dribbler to third, which Ryan Flaherty was in position to field cleanly\xe2\x80\xa6had the ball not hit the bag and popped over his head. Some things you have to chalk up to dumb luck, however of course some people would say that dumb luck seems to find those who aren\xe2\x80\x99t playing well to begin with.Trailing 5-1 in the fourth, Chris Davis got the Birds right back into the game with a three-run homer. However that ended the productive part of the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 day at the plate, as Cleveland just kept piling on runs. However I think that the aquisition of Thome immediately stole the spotlight from whatever ill might have come from this game. Incidentally, the Orioles also honored longtime manager and MLB hall of famer Earl Weaver with his statue unveiling before the game. (Wow, this is a lot to work into one measly game recap!) Weaver of course believed in pitching, good defense, and the three-run homer. So maybe that\xe2\x80\x99s why the Birds aquired Thome yesterday? Always a possibility!As I said, Thome is expected to be in uniform for the Orioles today, and he will presumably DH (we won\xe2\x80\x99t know that for sure until the lineup is announced). Thome will potentially add some support to the top of the lineup, along with Adam Jones. He\xe2\x80\x99ll also add some pop to the bottom of the order, as he\xe2\x80\x99ll probably push the likes of Chris Davis and Matt Wieters a bit lower in the lineup. Thome isn\xe2\x80\x99t the power-hitter that he was ten years ago, but he still has some pop in his bat and he could potentially help a team like the Orioles who are trying to prove to the world that they can at least be competitive in the playoff race deep into the season.Tommy Hunter was optioned to triple-A Norfolk after yesterday\xe2\x80\x99s game to make room for Thome on the roster, however there might be another roster move forthcoming. Miguel Gonzalez was removed from the lineup at Norfolk yesterday, and is presumably headed back to Baltimore. We\xe2\x80\x99ll know for sure before today\xe2\x80\x99s game. The Orioles need for Brian Matusz to go deep into today\xe2\x80\x99s game due to the fact that the bullpen is looking a bit tired and they\xe2\x80\x99ve been overused the past couple of days. Too add further urgency, the Orioles fly out to Seattle immediately following the game, and that\xe2\x80\x99s a rough enough trip with a rested bullpen. Matusz will be opposed by Justin Masterson, who gave up four runs over six innings on Tuesday in NY. However he has a 1.55 ERA in his last four starts. Jim Thome can\xe2\x80\x99t get to the Orioles soon enough!Follow me on Twitter @DomenicVadala ', 'birdswatcher.com')]

[('Palmer Puts Cy Youngs and Gold Gloves Up for Auction', '     Supported by    Baseball |                            Roundup                                                             Palmer Puts Cy Youngs and Gold Gloves Up for Auction  By THE ASSOCIATED PRESSJULY 2, 2012    Continue reading the main story Share This Page  Continue reading the main story                if (             window.magnum             && window.magnum.getFlags().indexOf(\'headlineBalancer\') > 0             && window.magnum.headlineBalancer             && window.magnum.headlineBalancer.initialize             && window.magnum.headlineBalancer.shouldRun()         ) {             window.magnum.headlineBalancer.initialize();         }        The former Baltimore Orioles ace Jim Palmer says he no longer needs trophies as mementos of his Hall of Fame career, so he has put his three Cy Young Awards and two of his four Gold Gloves up for auction.Palmer, currently a television analyst for the Orioles, did not say he was hurting financially. He said he was just looking to make some money by selling some of the hardware he received during his 19-year career in the major leagues.Each of the Cy Young trophies is expected to garner $60,000 to $80,000. The Gold Gloves are expected to receive bids up to $15,000.ANGELS 3, INDIANS 0 Jered Weaver carried a shutout into the eighth inning, squirming out of a bases-loaded jam in the seventh, to lead visiting Los Angeles over Cleveland on Monday night. Weaver (9-1) is 5-0 with 1.52 earned run average in eight career starts at Progressive Field. Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      Angels center fielder Mike Trout, who like Weaver was selected to the All-Star Game, missed the game with a jammed right pinkie.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  TWINS 6, TIGERS 4 Trevor Plouffe hit a two-run single during Minnesota\xe2\x80\x99s four-run fourth inning to help beat host Detroit. The Twins\xe2\x80\x99 victory was their fourth in a row, lifting Manager Ron Gardenhire to 900 career wins. ROYALS 11, BLUE JAYS 3 Mike Moustakas hit his first career grand slam and Everett Teaford pitched seven innings to pick up his first win of the season for Kansas City at Toronto. The Blue Jays\xe2\x80\x99 Jose Bautista hit his major-league-leading 27tth homer.BREWERS 6, MARLINS 5 Pinch-hitter Norichika Aoki drove in the decisive run for host Milwaukee with a safety squeeze in the eighth inning. Rickie Weeks scored after leading off the inning with a double.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Brewers said their longtime groundskeeper Jeff Adcock, 51, died after collapsing in the home bullpen during a game against Arizona on Sunday. The Milwaukee County medical examiner\xe2\x80\x99s office said Adcock probably died of natural causes, but it was investigating. Adcock had worked for the Brewers for 33 years.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  PIRATES 11, ASTROS 2 Garrett Jones and Neil Walker hit back-to-back homers off the right-field foul pole to spark host Pittsburgh, which won for the fifth time in six games.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  CARDINALS 9, ROCKIES 3 Allen Craig hit two home runs and Carlos Beltran extended his runs batted in streak to nine games as St. Louis won at home. PADRES 6, DIAMONDBACKS 2 Clayton Richard came within one out of a complete game andAlexi Amarista hit one of three San Diego home runs as the Padres beat host Arizona.Cameron Maybin hit a 485-foot home run, and Yasmani Grandal also connected for the Padres in their third straight win. Miguel Olivo and Dustin Ackley added back-to-back homers in the eighth as the Mariners rallied for the win.ALL-STAR VOTING CONTINUES After the announcement on Sunday of all but the final two roster slots for the All-Star Game, the National League and the American League each have a spot left, and fans will vote online through Thursday to select the players from five candidates in each league.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The veteran third baseman Chipper Jones of the Atlanta Braves and the Washington Nationals rookie Bryce Harper are two of the N.L. possibilities. The other N.L. candidates are Braves outfielder Michael Bourn; second baseman Aaron Hill of the Arizona Diamondbacks; and St. Louis Cardinals third baseman David Freese, the World Series most valuable player.The candidates for the A.L. spot are right-handers.
